task.title: Configuring Transformation Scenarios for a Framework

context.p: When distributing a framework to users, it is a good idea to have the transformation scenarios already configured. This helps the content authors publish their work in various formats. Being contained in the Document Type Association, the scenarios can be distributed along with the actions, menus, toolbars, and catalogs.
These are the steps that allow you to create a transformation scenario for your framework.

step.cmd: Create an xsl folder inside the frameworks/sdf folder.

stepresult.p: The folder structure for the documentation framework should be:
stepresult.codeblock: oxygen frameworks sdf schema css templates xsl

step.cmd: Create the sdf.xsl file in the xsl folder. The complete content of the sdf.xsl file is found in the Example Files Listings.

and go to Document Type Associations. Open the Document Type dialog for the SDF framework then choose the Transformation tab. Click the New button and choose the appropriate type of transformation (for example, XML transformation with XSLT).
step.info:
In the New scenario dialog box, fill in the following fields:
Fill in the Name field with SDF to HTML. This will be the name of your transformation scenario.
Set the XSL URL field to ${framework}/xsl/sdf.xsl.

fig.title: Configuring a New XSLT Transformation Scenario
Configuring a New XSLT Transformation Scenario

step.cmd: Change to the Output tab. Configure the fields as follows:

ul.li: Set the Save as field to ${cfd}/${cfn}.html. This means the transformation output file will have the name of the XML file and the html extension and will be stored in the same folder.

Select the Open in Browser/System Application option.To set the browser or system application that will be used, , go to Global, and set it in the Default Internet browser fieldgo to Window Preferences General Web Browser and specify it there. This will take precedence over the default system application settings.

step.cmd: Click the OK button to save the new scenario.

result.p: Now the scenario is listed in the Transformation tab:

postreq.p: To test the transformation scenario that you just created, open the SDF XML sample from the Example Files Listings. Click the Apply Transformation Scenario(s) button to display the Transform with dialog box. The scenario list contains the scenario you defined earlier . Select the SDF to HTML scenario that you just defined and click the Apply associated button. The HTML file is saved in the same folder as the XML file and displayed in the browser.
